result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: Case 16CF87, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Consecutive to: Case 16CF87.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

No violent contact with the victim.
Domestic violence counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
Defendant to enroll in parenting classes.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
May be served in Milwaukee County.
AMENDED 08-31-2016:  Effective  09-01-2016, the Court will stay the balance of Condition Time and to be used at the agent's discretion.
Consecutive to: Case 16CF87.

records.addlTxt:
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Devon L Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   
Motion filed by the Defense - For Immediate Transfer to Huber 
(Jail will not transfer the defendant to huber do to a hold placed on him from West Allis(municipal commitment).
West Allis is unwilling to drop the hold, put the defendant on a payment plan or count the time he is sitting here towards the commitment.

Atty. Schleis presented statements to the court (stay the balance of condition time).
State takes no position.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the West Allis Hold is a valid Commitment.
Therefore, the court is satisfied the jail is acting within their parameters and that is appropriate.
However, Court will Modify the Sentence.
Effective as of 09/01/16 court will stay the balance of the condition time to be used at the agent's discretion.
Amended JOC to be prepared.
Motion hearing on August 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.
and Motion for Immediate Transfer to Huber Facility filed by Attorney Schleis with proposed order.

From defendant received 5/27/16 regarding sentence.

6/1/16 - Copy of Judgment of Conviction provided to defendant.

Defendant Devon L Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE of: 

6  YEARS IMPRISONMENT CONSECUTIVE TO 16CF87
  3  YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  3  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEARS; CONSECUTIVE TO 16CF87

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No violent contact with victim.  
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
*Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certfied batterers intervention program.
*Defendant to enroll in parenting classes.
* Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

RESTITUTION:  $0.00 (none requested).

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision;

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision;

CONDITION TIME: 4 months with Huber (non-working hours) release for work, treatment, counseling, consecutive to 16CF87. Sentence may be served in Milwaukee County.

Defendant's probation may be served through Milwaukee County.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Hearing at 01-27-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Devon L Smith in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Will requests that there be a Stipulation of parties for identification, as Officer is not the one that arrested the defendant. Atty. Schleis is in agreement. Officer Bryan Spakowicz from the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Schleis. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Atty. Schleis provides closing statements and requests dismissal of the case.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Atty. Schleis requests to address bail conditions. Atty. Will stated the victim is not here to address the no contact. Court will not modify the bond conditions without the victim contacting the District Attorney's Office or Victim Witness.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.
